question.body: Which of the following correctly describes fast glycolytic fibers?

multiple_choice.choice: Produce large amounts of tension, possess large amounts of myoglobin molecules, possess large amounts of glycogen.
Produce large amounts of tension, possess large amounts of myoglobin molecules, possess small amounts of glycogen.
Produce large amounts of tension, possess few myoglobin molecules, possess large stores of glycogen.
Produce small amounts of tension, possess large amounts of myoglobin molecules, possess large amounts of glycogen.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Though the other characteristics are true, these fibers do not contain many myoglobin molecules.
Incorrect. Though the other characteristics are true, these fibers contain large amounts of glycogen for energy.
Correct. These are all characteristics of fast glycolytic fibers.
Incorrect. Though the other characteristics are true, these fibers produce a large amount of tension.
